name: render
summary: Render OSM data as visual maps (PNG, PDF, HTML, WebGL)
description:
The render command creates visual representations of OSM data in multiple formats:

- PNG: Static raster images (pure Python, no dependencies)
- PDF: Publication-ready vector graphics (no Type 3 fonts)
- HTML/Leaflet: Interactive web maps with tile backgrounds
- WebGL/3D: 3D visualization with extruded buildings

All rendering is done with zero external dependencies using pure Python.

options.-f, --format: Output format: png, pdf, html, leaflet, webgl, 3d
options.--style: Color style: default, dark, light, blueprint
options.--page-size: PDF page size: letter, a4, a3, a2, legal
options.--bbox: Bounding box to render: MIN_LAT MAX_LAT MIN_LON MAX_LON
options.--layer: Render specific layer: all, roads, buildings, water, pois, landuse
options.--tiles: HTML tile provider: osm, carto-light, carto-dark, esri-satellite

output:
PNG: Raster image with legend and scale bar
PDF: Vector graphics suitable for publication
HTML: Interactive map opening in browser
WebGL: 3D visualization with building extrusions
